<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 278, 326, 294]]<|/det|>
## ADDITIONAL MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 299, 155, 314]]<|/det|>
Paper 2  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[782, 278, 905, 333]]<|/det|>
0606/22 May/June 2019 2 hours  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 338, 418, 354]]<|/det|>
Candidates answer on the Question Paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 359, 437, 374]]<|/det|>
Additional Materials: Electronic calculator  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 390, 388, 406]]<|/det|>
## READ THESE INSTRUCTIONS FIRST  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 416, 715, 431]]<|/det|>
Write your centre number, candidate number and name on all the work you hand in.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 431, 320, 445]]<|/det|>
Write in dark blue or black pen.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 445, 504, 460]]<|/det|>
You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 460, 504, 475]]<|/det|>
Do not use staples, paper clips, glue or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 475, 384, 489]]<|/det|>
DO NOT WRITE IN ANY BARCODES.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 501, 282, 515]]<|/det|>
Answer all the questions.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 515, 828, 545]]<|/det|>
Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place in the case of angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 545, 599, 559]]<|/det|>
The use of an electronic calculator is expected, where appropriate.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 559, 604, 574]]<|/det|>
You are reminded of the need for clear presentation in your answers.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 585, 606, 600]]<|/det|>
At the end of the examination, fasten all your work securely together.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 600, 759, 615]]<|/det|>
The number of marks is given in brackets [ ] at the end of each question or part question.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 615, 440, 629]]<|/det|>
The total number of marks for this paper is 80.

<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[401, 73, 594, 91]]<|/det|>
Mathematical Formulae  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[440, 165, 559, 183]]<|/det|>
## 1. ALGEBRA  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 196, 233, 214]]<|/det|>
Quadratic Equation  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 225, 371, 244]]<|/det|>
For the equation \(ax^{2} + bx + c = 0,\)  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[420, 242, 571, 282]]<|/det|>
\[x = \frac{-b\pm\sqrt{b^{2} - 4ac}}{2a}\]  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 312, 222, 330]]<|/det|>
Binomial Theorem  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[250, 333, 745, 375]]<|/det|>
\[(a + b)^{n} = a^{n} + \binom{n}{1} a^{n - 1}b + \binom{n}{2} a^{n - 2}b^{2} + \ldots +\binom{n}{r} a^{n - r}b^{r} + \ldots +b^{n},\]  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 380, 479, 419]]<|/det|>
where \(n\) is a positive integer and \(\binom{n}{r} = \frac{n!}{(n - r)!r!}\)  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[405, 481, 591, 500]]<|/det|>
## 2. TRIGONOMETRY  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 514, 153, 531]]<|/det|>
Identities  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[420, 542, 581, 610]]<|/det|>
\[\sin^{2}A + \cos^{2}A = 1\] \[\sec^{2}A = 1 + \tan^{2}A\] \[\csc^{2}A = 1 + \cot^{2}A\]  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 641, 235, 659]]<|/det|>
Formulae for \(\Delta ABC\)  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[408, 664, 590, 696]]<|/det|>
\[\frac{a}{\sin A} = \frac{b}{\sin B} = \frac{c}{\sin C}\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[405, 715, 590, 770]]<|/det|>
\[a^{2} = b^{2} + c^{2} - 2bc\cos A\] \[\Delta = \frac{1}{2} bc\sin A\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 79, 94, 98]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 520, 107]]<|/det|>
Given that \(y = \frac{\sin x}{\ln x^2}\) , find an expression for \(\frac{\mathrm{d}y}{\mathrm{d}x}\) .

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[892, 78, 922, 98]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 466, 92, 485]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 465, 821, 488]]<|/det|>
Find the values of \(k\) for which the equation \((k - 1)x^{2} + kx - k = 0\) has real and distinct roots.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[892, 465, 922, 485]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 75, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 75, 143, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 74, 920, 95]]<|/det|>
Given that \(x - 2\) is a factor of \(ax^{3} - 12x^{2} + 5x + 6\), use the factor theorem to show that \(a = 4\). [2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 295, 141, 314]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 293, 912, 316]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 312, 920, 330]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 75, 92, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 920, 109]]<|/det|>
A circle has diameter \(x\) which is increasing at a constant rate of \(0.01 \mathrm{cm s}^{-1}\) . Find the exact rate of change of the area of the circle when \(x = 6 \mathrm{cm}\).
